text: A generative transformer model was employed to simulate future urban heat patterns based on satellite imagery and meteorological data, aiming to assist city planners in mitigating heat islands.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: Using diffusion models, we generated potential urban traffic scenarios under varying pedestrian influx to aid city traffic department forecasting.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: To support smart energy grids, we developed a GAN-based system to predict peak energy consumption and simulate counterfactual demand-response strategies.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: Our system utilizes LLMs to auto-generate citizen-friendly summaries of urban policy documents, enhancing participatory governance in smart city contexts.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: We propose a multimodal architecture combining LLMs and spatial encoders to dynamically generate zoning recommendations in rapidly growing urban areas.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: We use a generative model to produce synthetic datasets for training flood prediction systems, although it is not deployed directly in any smart city infrastructure.
label: Not related

text: Our study employs LLMs to generate summaries of urban reports, but the tool is primarily designed for academic research purposes rather than smart city deployment.
label: Not related

text: An AI system generates designs for green buildings using transformer models. While not directly implemented in smart cities, the tool is aligned with sustainable urban practices.
label: Not related

text: Generative neural networks were used to visualize crowd behavior in stadiums for safety simulations. While applicable to smart city domains, it remains experimental.
label: Not related

text: Transformer-based models are explored to generate synthetic street layouts, but the tool is developed for game design environments and not urban planning.
label: Not related

text: A new generative model was tested for producing art in the style of Van Gogh. The results contribute to digital creativity but are not connected to urban or smart city applications.
label: Not related

text: We apply generative AI to develop personalized learning paths for students in virtual classrooms. Although innovative, the system is unrelated to urban development.
label: Not related

text: The model generates synthetic music samples based on user preferences. This has no current linkage with smart city applications.
label: Not related

text: GANs are employed to generate interior design layouts for residential buildings. The system focuses on aesthetics and does not intersect with city-level planning.
label: Not related

text: We use a variational autoencoder to compress genomic data for bioinformatics research, which is entirely unrelated to smart city or urban planning efforts.
label: Not related

text: We integrated a fine-tuned LLaMA model into our urban traffic analysis pipeline. The model generates structured metadata from video feeds (e.g., lane occupancy, vehicle classification) that feeds directly into the city’s real-time traffic orchestration system.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: To harmonize historical utility records, we applied a GPT-4 model to infer missing building addresses and convert free-form textual inputs into standardized formats for geospatial indexing.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: This study proposes a hybrid architecture using GPT-J to extract textual insights from utility reports, which are then fused with time-series models to forecast district-level energy consumption.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: Using GPT-4V, the system interprets site images and maintenance reports to identify deviations from approved construction plans in real-time, enhancing regulatory oversight in smart infrastructure development.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: A local municipality deployed a BERT-based summarizer fine-tuned on emergency transcripts to classify call urgency and recommend optimal dispatch locations, reducing response latency.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: A generative model was deployed to extract features from aerial scans of underground cable routes, improving safety inspections and maintenance prioritization across a large-scale urban grid.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: Fine-tuned LLMs were integrated with mobility platforms to detect anomalies in public bus operations and automatically generate performance reports for fleet managers.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: A GenAI-enabled chatbot was implemented at smart city kiosks to guide visitors using local maps, real-time events, and multimodal wayfinding instructions.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: A district energy monitoring system uses a transformer-based model to correlate historical energy logs and building usage notes, enabling predictive load balancing strategies.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: Urban noise reports were translated into actionable noise source profiles using LLM summarization and classification, improving enforcement and acoustic zoning.
label: GenAI used for smart city application

text: We used Claude 2 to summarize decades of urban development literature to support graduate teaching materials.
label: Not related

text: Researchers used ChatGPT to draft sections of a literature review on participatory design in cities.
label: Not related

text: The tool leverages LLMs to provide readable summaries of zoning laws for law students. It does not feed into city workflows.
label: Not related

text: A GPT-4 chatbot was used in stakeholder workshops to generate hypothetical narratives for climate adaptation. Outputs were not integrated into urban simulation tools.
label: Not related

text: A professor used GPT-3 to draft a course syllabus for a class on AI and the city.
label: Not related

text: GPT-4 was used to help translate policy documents into Spanish for internal use in a research team. There was no deployment in city systems.
label: Not related

text: An AI workshop explored using LLMs to brainstorm urban resilience strategies, but no models were deployed in practical tools.
label: Not related

text: An art installation in a museum used a fine-tuned GPT model to generate speculative narratives about future cities. It was not used in planning or infrastructure.
label: Not related

text: Students applied a generative AI model to fictionalize urban futures in their architecture coursework.
label: Not related

text: A comparative study tested LLM performance in summarizing UN-Habitat reports but did not assess applicability in urban systems.
label: Not related

text: Smart cities are increasingly adopting AI tools. Models like GPT-4 and LLaMA have seen rising attention, though our work focuses on rule-based air quality inference.
label: Not related

text: Recent tools such as ChatGPT show potential in NLP. However, we adopt traditional classification models for our citizen feedback analysis.
label: Not related

text: While our current pipeline uses CNNs for surveillance image detection, future iterations might explore GenAI tools like Stable Diffusion or GPT-4.
label: Not related

text: Generative AI is reshaping urban computing. In this paper, however, we focus on rule-based heuristics for pedestrian zone allocation.
label: Not related

text: We reference ChatGPT in the related work section for its role in NLP, but our system uses traditional parsers for all data inputs.
label: Not related

text: Although DALL·E is noted in the introduction, we use only CAD and GIS tools for building design assessments.
label: Not related

text: The report mentions LLMs as a trend but does not include any NLP model or AI workflow in the methodology.
label: Not related

text: GPT-3 is listed among candidate models, but we ultimately rely on a decision-tree classifier trained on survey text.
label: Not related

text: The appendix includes a list of GenAI tools, but none were used or evaluated in the experiments.
label: Not related

text: A section introduces generative AI research in urban contexts, but the core model relies on hardcoded logic.
label: Not related
